documented_commands: jira-as admin group add-user GROUP_NAME --user EMAIL
jira-as admin group remove-user GROUP_NAME --user EMAIL --confirm
jira-as admin screen add-field SCREEN_ID FIELD_ID
jira-as admin screen remove-field SCREEN_ID FIELD_ID
actual_commands: jira-as admin screen add-field SCREEN_ID FIELD_ID
jira-as admin screen remove-field SCREEN_ID FIELD_ID

findings.description: SKILL.md documents 'jira-as admin automation list --project PROJ' as the base command syntax. Actual CLI has '--project' as an optional filter parameter (-p), not required. The documented example is misleading because it always requires a project parameter.
findings.recommendation: Update documentation to show 'jira-as admin automation list' as the base command with '--project PROJ' as an optional filter. Add examples showing both filtered and unfiltered list operations.

findings.description: SKILL.md documents full command syntax 'jira-as admin permission check --project DEMO' but shows '--project' as a positional example. The actual CLI requires '-p/--project PROJECT_KEY' as a required option. The documented example is correct, but the permission check examples in the troubleshooting section don't show the option syntax clearly.
findings.recommendation: Verify and clarify that '--project' is required for permission check. Update troubleshooting section line 327 to match the documented syntax exactly.

findings.description: SKILL.md documents '--confirm' flag for group delete, but the actual CLI also supports '-y' as shorthand AND '--dry-run' for preview. The documentation is incomplete - it omits the preview capability and the shorter flag option.
findings.recommendation: Update to show: 'jira-as admin group delete GROUP_NAME --confirm' and add note that '-y' is equivalent. Add example showing '--dry-run' preview capability for safety.

findings.documented_syntax: jira-as admin group remove-user GROUP_NAME --user EMAIL --confirm
findings.actual_syntax: jira-as admin group remove-user GROUP_NAME [-u | --user TEXT] [-y | --confirm]
findings.description: SKILL.md documents '--user EMAIL' but the actual CLI accepts '-u/--user TEXT' which could be account ID or email. The documentation is incomplete - it omits '-u' shorthand flag and doesn't clarify that both account IDs and emails are accepted.
findings.recommendation: Update documentation to show: 'jira-as admin group remove-user GROUP_NAME --user ACCOUNT_ID_OR_EMAIL --confirm' and clarify that both account IDs and email addresses are accepted for the --user parameter.

findings.location: Line 186, 'User & Group Management' section, and line 261 'Getting Started' section
findings.description: SKILL.md documents basic user search but omits documented options: '-g/--include-groups' (include group memberships), '-p/--project' (filter by assignable to project), '-a/--assignable' (requires --project), and '--all' (include inactive users). The documentation example in line 261 includes '--include-groups' which is correct, but the main command reference doesn't document these options.
findings.recommendation: Add a note after the user search command documenting available filters: --include-groups, --project, --assignable, --all, and --max-results. Update examples to show practical usage of these options.

excluded_findings.reason: Not a significant documentation gap - CLI implementation detail
excluded_findings.item: automation list --all flag for fetching all pages
Various --output [text|json] flags (already documented in common patterns)
PROJ vs PROJECT_KEY, ID vs SCHEME_ID (examples show patterns correctly)

documentation_strengths: All major command categories are documented
Risk levels clearly defined for each operation
Good coverage of automation rules, permission schemes, and workflow management
Common patterns section shows JSON output and dry-run capabilities
documentation_weaknesses: Optional vs required parameters not always clear in examples
User search command omits filter options in main reference
Permission check command documented but lacks troubleshooting clarity
Group operations don't highlight --dry-run capability for deletion operations
automation list and automation search both exist but documentation could clarify the distinction
